page.title: 14BLACKBUSHE METALS
page.content: Blackbushe Metals is one of the busiest metal reprocessing businesses in Southern England and plays a part in conserving the country's resources by re-cycling discarded goods,such as cars, trucks,refrigerators, washing machines and bicycles.Nearly 1,000 tonnes of scrap metal a week are provided for the British Steel industry.Small or large amounts of scrap metal are accepted and non-ferrous metals.The Hammermill Car Fragmentation Plant, a Becker compression shear and several caterpillar cranes process and sort the metal, both ferrous and non-ferrous.Dirty waste (rubber, cloth, mud) is used for landfill purposes. The re-cycled metal is taken to the steel mills in Wales.
